etymology.description: semantic: 攴 (“to tap/act”) + phonetic: 尚
etymology.interpretation: 尚 lends the chǎng sound, while 攴 adds the sense of an action, suggesting spreading or opening by an act. Together they evoke opening things wide so space feels ample.

examples.chinese: 他把窗户敞开(他把窗戶敞開)，让新鲜空气进来(讓新鮮空氣進來)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ chuānghu chǎngkāi, ràng xīnxiān kōngqì jìnlái.
examples.english: He opened the windows wide, letting fresh air in.

examples.chinese: 大门敞开(大門敞開)，欢迎大家进入(歡迎大家進入)。
examples.english: The main gate is wide open, welcoming everyone to enter.

examples.chinese: 这间屋子很敞亮(這間屋子很敞亮)。
examples.english: This room is bright and spacious.
